title: Composition and Argumentation for Engineers
prereqCoreqText: Students must complete all English as a Second Language (ESL) Courses required on admission prior to enrolling.

title: Technical Writing and Communication
prereqCoreqText: Students must have satisfied the requirements in Section 71.20.7 Writing Skills Requirement, by passing the Engineering Writing Test (EWT) or bypassing ENCS 272 with a grade of Câ€‘ or higher, prior to enrolling.

title: Research Methods, Ethics, Law and Regulation for Computational Biology
prereqCoreqText: The following courses must be completed previously: ENCS 282 or equivalent. Students must complete a minimum of 27 credits as part of the BCompSc in Health and Life Sciences or BSc in Systems and Information Biology programs prior to enrolling. If prerequisites are not satisfied, permission of the Department is required.

title: Social and Ethical Dimensions of Information and Communication Technologies
prereqCoreqText: The following course must be completed previously: ENCS 282. Students must complete 30 credits in their degree program prior to enrolling.

title: Creativity, Innovation and Critical Thinking in Science and Technology
prereqCoreqText: Students must complete a minimum of 60 credits in an engineering program or minimum of 45 credits in a non-engineering program prior to enrolling.

title: Development and Global Engineering
prereqCoreqText: Students must complete a minimum of 60 credits in an engineering program or minimum of 45 credits in a non-engineering program prior to enrolling.

title: Field Course in Engineering and Sustainable Development
prereqCoreqText: Students must complete a minimum of 24 credits towards an undergraduate program offered by the Gina Cody School of Engineering and Computer Science prior to enrolling, with a minimum GPA of 2.50.

title: Topics in Engineering and Computer Science
prereqCoreqText: Permission of the GCS is required.
